I would like to humbly suggest some sort of visual personification of github co-pilot that can live in my window, as I am growing quite fond of the little robot and would like to form a cartoonish anthropomorphized working relationship, please
If I wanted to interview someone at @github about GitHub co-pilot and ask a million questions who would that person be
https://t.co/fZiiYzIk8Y

the new pattern is basically this: set up all my variables and get all of my data loaded and transformed, and then write comments where I describe things I would like to do that data, and the robot is pretty good at jamming from there
like it's not exactly groundbreaking, but this is a very reasonable, helpful, time-saving suggestion that happens to be exactly what I was about to write https://t.co/zpQzWO872w
No sleep! Who needs it!
@VRSJMS @katieraffa
@TravelingAnna Any chance you could give me a push in the right direction?

has anybody (publicly) asked news consumers what they want, recently, in detail? 

I want to take a week soon to compile all the research / polling about how people actually want to consume their news

@swyx That type of interview makes sense to me – I was talking more code/technical interviews (which I no longer do, I was never good at them, didn't think they were good for evaluating candidates as a manager, and I have a ton of public code and show my process on Twitter a lot)

To my TV news friends who see this approach and are terrified by it, wondering "but how are we going to fill that air time?" – you could, instead, just look more deeply at the data, if you trusted your viewers. https://t.co/sS3isOud8C
@swyx well you can just choose not to work with people who don't know your public persona and want to interview you about things you clearly already know

@jaspergregory haven't you see that old video of British soldiers attempting drills after being dosed? I'm imagining something like that.
@jaspergregory I think this is probably the pinnacle of my disagreement with you- because that sounds great.

RT @jaspergregory: Apparently people used to drop LSD during protests. I really can't imagine people being that crazy.
playing a little Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2. http://raptr.com/pseudoplacebo
Watching the new Psych. The cold open is scary. Scary doesn't cheer me up. =[
I wasted an entire day.
Searching for something to change, some cycle to break. Still unhappy...
Completely unable to do anything I want to do for the past like day and a half.
Holdin' it down with data, a sketchpad, and Akron/Family.
#notetoself Email The Moth Podcast and tell them how much I love them.
I love writing in my red moleskine... and now I will sleep. Wake up early tomorrow and work. It will be nice though.
Skins is the best scored show on television.
Skins. Is THE. Best. Show. On. Television.
OH GOOD GOD NEW SKINS WILL PUT ME IN A GREAT MOOD
I think it's safe to say Shaq is the epitome of the human race.
I completely disproved Taylyn's argument and her response was just a self-confident "Yeah."
Listening to Taylyn read this song aloud with no knowledge of the melody or song structure is truly hilarious: http://is.gd/kjzn
But on a lighter note I am 6 followers away from 250 which is cool. I feel like I should give away something to my 250th follower.
I think I emotionally felt my shit being trashed. At least I know why I feel bad now.
Feeling unanswerably bad
Home. Feeling oddly unhappy... no idea why.
Playing the piano.
Making some mac & cheese- grated cheese, parmesean... shaping up to be delicious.
Playing CoD4 with Max, Zack, and Danny.
